reviews.review_msg: Likes to listen to himself a bit too much :-), but he's a nice guy, and his classes were really reasonable: the Zoom seminars were short and sweet, which them engaging and productive but not exhausting. Why didn't all profs at SFU do this??? Interesting material presented by somebody who cares about History. A++

A really good course thanks to a professor who's passionate and (obviously) reeeeealy loves History. Taking his course in Surrey kind of sucked, because the campus set-up made it hard for him to have regular office hours, and the tutorials were kind of weird (strange fishbowl rooms), but Lanthier was inspiring in a quirky, cynical sort of way.

Looking back at my degree now that I'm almost done, one of the best teachers I had while at SFU. Pushes students to think and question without being obnoxious or in-your-face. Cares about History, about learning, and about people. I enjoyed the class at the time, but really appreciate it now that's over.

Really interesting professor who cares about the subject and is willing to put a lot of work into helping his students. Funny and engaging, even if his lectures are dense and you have to take a lot of notes. I didn't appreciate it at the time because I was busy and stressed out, but definitely on of the best proffs I've had at SFU.

A year later, I realize that this course was both super-useful for taking more advance History AND that it was taught by somebody really nice who knows his stuff. The course seemed kind of hard at the time, but now I can see I was wrong. There was a lot of reading, but Dr. Lanthier's marks were really generous.

Michael is very kind and helpful. His lectures are great but his slides do not really give much information. For the most part, he reiterates the assigned textbook readings and just expands within his point of view in lectures. In tests and wants specificity but quite generous in essays. Overall great professor, but a tough marker.

There was a LOT of reading in this class, and as an Engineering student I wasn't used to this kind of Arts stuff: it was tougher than I was expecting. Professor Lanthier was the best part of the course, and he made the material clear and interesting. He expects a lot, but if you put in some real effort you'll be just fine.
Dr. Lanthier is a very nice prof and so chill. His tests and assignments are straightforward and he's an easy marker. Really enjoyed this class.
A lot of reading. I found this class hard, but others thought it was easy. A lot of info to know. He wants his students to do well and is a caring, passionate prof.

The first few weeks of this course was fine but after that, he started assigning two chapters a week. One chapter is already 35-40 pages long plus he makes you read 4-6 primary sources on top of the weekly readings. This class is very demanding and I wouldn't recommend taking it unless you have to. Good luck.

Pretty boring, so bring coffee. Didn't need the textbook at all. The slides are summaries of the readings from the textbook. Knows his stuff. The TA I had sucked and marked difficulty. The final was wretched. I'd suggest reading the novels since you have to write a short essay for it in the midterm and the final.

Michael is honestly a really good prof. His lectures were clear and informative. He clearly is passionate about history which was seen a lot throughout our class, but he was understanding if you werent that well versed. I honestly didnt try a lot in this class, but an A is more than doable if you participate in tutorials and keep up with readings

Michael really knows his stuff and you can tell he's passionate about the subject. He gets interesting and useful discussions going during lectures. Attend tutorials since you'll discuss the readings and novels that you'll be tested on in the midterm and final. Don't get the textbook. Same content is summarized profusely on the slides.

The final exam for the course was kind of a killer, but the midterm and the long paper before that were super-easy, so it's all good. Professor Lanthier made the course really interesting and fun even though we covered a LOT of material in a short period of time.

Dr. Lanthier obviously loves what he does and he wants his students to care about history too. He manages to relate stuff that happened a long time ago to events in the news today, and this course has really opened my eyes and made me think about the world in a different way. Highly recommend.
Dr. Lanthier is very passionate about what he teaches, which makes the long lectures bearable. Workload is quite light, and tutorials are engaging. Overall, an excellent professor.

Good instructor who obviously wants his students to do well. Likes Paris and history a whole lot, and has good stories to tell about the city that help you better understand, well, a whole lot of stuff. The class, the topic and the books seemed pretty intimidating at first, but the whole thing was pretty easy thanks to Michael.

HIST 106 is a great first-year course for anybody in the Arts and Social Sciences--I just took it by accident in Surrey, but it's been really useful to have under my belt during my second year. Profesor Lanthier made the whole thing pretty painless and even fun. Yah, there's a lot of reading, but it's not as bad as other courses. Take it!

Dr. Lanthier is outstanding. He's incredibly knowledgeable when it comes to European history, but he is also very understanding with students that aren't as well versed. He was very quick when it came to marking, and he always gave very detailed feedback. I'd take a class with him again in a heartbeat

This was a really enjoyable fourth-year course.  There was almost always good energy in the room, and Doctor Lanthier struck the right balance: he let students do most of the talking , but he also put us back on the right path when we got off-track and gave us additional information and insight when it was useful.

Good school, good class, good prof.  I enjoyed this more than I thought I would.  There was a lot of reading, and I wasn't really used to that, but Prof. Lanthier made it clear what we needed to know on the exams.  Lanthier's a nice guy, really approachable, and will give good advice on how to do well on assignemtns and test.

I hate the SFU class model where you have to take a tutorial with a bunch of bored people who didn't do the readings.  But that not Professor Lanthier's fault.  He did everything he could to make the experience pleasant.  The lectures were interesting and clear, the tutorials not too bad.  He told you exactly what you needed to know on the exams.

Took his seminar on the French Revolution last year, and it was a lot more interesting than I though it would be.  There was good interaction in the classroom, and Dr. Lanthier really encouraged that and was willing to take a back seat.  But he still had a lot to say, and he made the French Revolution seem really relevant to the 21st century.

This was one of the best classes I took at SFU, even though I didn't realize it back then (I was just a dumb kid :-).  Professor Lanthier cares about his work, he cares about History, and he cares about his students.  The lectures were usually really interesting and gave you a lot to think about,even if I didn't always see that.  Take his classes!

Very good at his job, and veyr respectful of all his students during discussions.  Does not give his own opinion all the time like some other SFU professors in the Arts, and that's important to me.  There was lot of reading in this class, maybe a little too much, but exams and essays are actually pretty easy so far.

Great prof, one of the best I've had at SFU.  Cares about the stuff he teaches and about his students.  Treats everybody with respect, and is totally willing to take the time to help you if you approach him.  You DO have to talk in his seminars, and you've got to have read ahead of time to do that, but he never puts you on the spot.  Great class.

Easy marker, even if he talks tough at the beginning of the course and says he has high standards.  Like others have said, very entertaining and knowledgeable.  It's easy to get into the A range with him as long as you're willing to do a bit of work.  Gives a lot of feedback and suggestions if you ask for it.

A prof who is extremely knowledgeable on the French Revolution, but don't let that intimidate you. He comes across like he will be a harsh marker but is actually quite fair.  There is quite a bit of reading, but he facilitates conversation well which makes it easy for you to participate and earn those extra marks

I took HIST 416 three (four?) summers ago, and it was a really good class.  I thought that it was demanding and involved a lot of reading at the time, and it kind of stressed me out because I was working 40 h/w.  But I got a lot out of it, and I really liked the way he connected the French Revolution to modern events + big philosophical problems.

I took History 401 with Dr. Lanthier in spring 2015 and found it to be a great course! The texts he assigned on Weimar Germany were relevant, and well worth keeping. Yes, it was a lot of reading, but I can say it was one of the few courses that i've taken during my degree that has really made me a better historian.

So this is the first year he teaches history in french, and it seems like he's still doing well. However, he isn't clear on requirements for papers and WILL NOT tell you his grading scheme, which makes things very difficult for students like me.

Canadian History is always going to be pretty boring no matter what, but Dr. Lanthier's course is good enough to almost make me want to learn more the topic.  Almost.  Really good lectures by the prof, OK tutorials but those are almost always a waste of time anyway.  If you want to take HIST 101 without dying of boredom, take it with Lanthier.

French Revolution - Passionate about subject, expects lots of discussion, very clear with his expectations on assignments. Doesn't expect perfection on style formatting for papers. Classes were interesting. Expected students to have more background knowledge although there was no prereq except 60credits.

Alright, so i took 106 with him about 2-3 years ago. Im almost done my history degree, and after spending time with a lot of other history profs, i realize how AWESOME Lanthier was. sorta creepy in tutorial when he looks at you, but good feedback, and overall the only class i never fell asleep in! You cant expect better than him! goodluck
Great professor, enjoyed his teaching a lot.
Lectures are easy to understand, & he speaks slowly enough to get all the notes. Tutorials are good. You won't leave his class without learning something new. Enjoyed it very much.

Lectures clearly concisely at a pace that allows one to keep up. Readings are interesting and manageable- good use of classic satires and novels. Marking could be a little less ambiguous with a grade and %.Tutorials could have a little more variety. Good History Prof! (4 out of 5)

Great young professor who takes time for his students. Very knowlegeable about the history of Europe which makes his lectures interesting. He speaks a little slowly which makes note taking easy because he covers a lot of material. His grading is quite fair and tests both on lectures and out of the readings. Reccomend him to anybody.

He speaks too slowly and that makes the lectures sort of dull. If he double his pace I think he would be an excellent prof. Other than that, he is fair and has interesting material to cover in tutorials. Sometimes when I get bored in class I just stare at him to creep him out.

He made the class very interesting and it was a nice change from the usual lecture setting of history classes.  However he did not hand back many marks until the very end, leaving most students very worried about their standing until the very end!  Overall a great, enthouiastic teacher who is still interested in teaching and helping his students.

Great Prof!  I loved this class and really liked that we didn't just sit and listen to lectures.  Nice use of other relevant materials like novels and parts of a movie.  
 This prof seems to know a lot, marks fairly and is totally willing to help students.  Definitely take this class.
Good class.  Teacher is thoughtful and considerate of students and their ideas.  Try him.
Great Prof.  Young teacher who still thinks that students are worth his time.  The reading levels were reasonable, as was his expectations.  Nice guy.
